name: politico
text:
The U.S. has more than 3 million confirmed Covid-19 cases, as many states deal with alarming surges. What's next? Stay informed with the most critical coronavirus facts and insight from experts across our global newsroom. Sign up for POLITICO Nightly now.
https://t.co/4vI42TQ6qb https://t.co/0DPwxyAGne

name: politico
text:
A vague sense of parental dread was made palpable with a gut punch today in California.

Gov. Newsom shut down significant parts of the economy (again) and the state's largest school districts, in L.A. and San Diego, said they will not reopen next month
https://t.co/c1ZIkEkjA0

name: politico
text:
Armed with an advantage in the polls, an outsider message and President Trump's endorsement, Tommy Tuberville has spent the past 19 weeks sitting on his lead over Jeff Sessions, as Tuesday's GOP primary runoff for Senate in Alabama finally approaches

https://t.co/nsTHHIQ0do

name: politico
text:
The Trump administration is planning to extend restrictions barring non-essential travel across the Mexican and Canadian borders until at least late August, according to three people familiar with the plans

https://t.co/ah5jR8yS4o

name: politico
text:
Trump has spent the past two weeks demanding ‚Äî often in all caps on Twitter ‚Äî that American schools reopen this fall.

But America's biggest school systems are rejecting him across the country. And the president has little power to do anything about it
https://t.co/BrScb1RZck

name: politico
text: The House late Monday night urged the Supreme Court to take its final formal steps to obtain President Trump‚Äôs personal financial records https://t.co/LIfmWzKPzm

name: politico
text:
Some pharmaceutical companies developing Covid-19 vaccine candidates have pledged to not take a profit.

But neither the companies nor the U.S. government bankrolling the vaccine research has defined what forgoing a profit means or how long that will last
https://t.co/TbyjpfSbjf

name: politico
text:
Visitors to New York from states where Covid-19 infections are on the rise could face a $2,000 fine if they fail to provide information about where they plan to quarantine for two weeks, Gov. Andrew Cuomo said Monday

https://t.co/WGoGFsDJg6

name: politico
text:
The government is canceling uncashed coronavirus-related stimulus checks that were sent to people who died

https://t.co/ySlMyAud8Y

name: politico
text:
Officials called the recent uptick among young adults a warning sign that people in that age group must be cautious even as NYC gradually reopens its economy

https://t.co/OTDtNkElT2

name: politico
text:
Donald Trump on Monday launched new attacks on his own administration‚Äôs public health officials, while the White House denied that it had perpetrated a smear campaign against Dr. Anthony Fauci

https://t.co/36H016FBcl

name: politico
text: As agriculture grows more reliant on unprecedented taxpayer support, farm policy experts and watchdog groups warn the subsidies are growing too big and too fast https://t.co/PdIYaGp3XY

name: politico
text: Sen. Elizabeth Warren and Rep. Ayanna Pressley are requesting that HHS submit a report detailing the Trump administration's response to racial health disparities exacerbated by the Covid-19 outbreak https://t.co/il4OXROt3Y

name: politico
text: The first execution to be carried out by the federal government in more than 17 years appears to be nearing again after the Supreme Court stepped in during overnight hours to clear away a lower court injunction https://t.co/UAYPKM99Lx

name: politico
text: Iran has executed a former employee of the defense ministry who was convicted of spying on behalf of the Central Intelligence Agency https://t.co/eKWBTExor0

name: politico
text: President Trump's requests and demands ‚Äî from holding a GOP convention to reopening schools ‚Äî are being met with pushback from all sides https://t.co/1WS7imlctU

name: politico
text: With coronavirus cases surging and a debate raging over reopening schools this fall, the GOP has come around to the idea of another recovery package  ‚Äî and we could see some movement as soon as next week https://t.co/m2lTFDLlRw

name: politico
text: A dozen Republican Party strategists and donors warned in interviews that not enough GOP campaigns are taking active steps to properly use the tools at their disposal to haul in money https://t.co/SIwriwq0F4

name: politico
text: The former CDC chiefs noted that during their combined 15-year-plus period leading the agency, they could not ‚Äúrecall over our collective tenure a single time when political pressure led to a change in the interpretation of scientific evidence‚Äù https://t.co/vSdtFjdCa4

name: politico
text: In today's primaries, Democrats will lock down their roster of Senate candidates for November. Here are 7Ô∏è‚É£ things we're watching üëá https://t.co/OcHsj7m3a8

name: politico
text: 1Ô∏è‚É£ Trump has made it clear how much he despises Sessions. But will the Alabama Republicans who voted for Sessions for decades abandon him for Trump‚Äôs candidate Tommy Tuberville? https://t.co/OcHsj7m3a8 https://t.co/Z0n723eFuG

name: politico
text: 2Ô∏è‚É£ Can Democrats get their candidate in Texas? MJ Hegar, a combat veteran who narrowly lost a 2018 House race, won the March 3 primary but fell short of a majority and faces a runoff against state Sen. Royce West  https://t.co/OcHsj7m3a8 https://t.co/JLUIQn6Hq8

name: politico
text: 3Ô∏è‚É£ State House Speaker Sara Gideon and Sen. Susan Collins have been running general election campaigns against each other for months ‚Äî but today it will all-but-certainly become official in Maine https://t.co/OcHsj7m3a8 https://t.co/iZMxJUIHEH

name: politico
text: 4Ô∏è‚É£ The primary runoff for this deep-red swath of the Texas Panhandle pits Trump‚Äôs former White House physician against Josh Winegarner, who is endorsed by the outgoing incumbent, Rep. Mac Thornberry (R-Texas) https://t.co/OcHsj7m3a8 https://t.co/dImcx7T38a

name: politico
text: 5Ô∏è‚É£ The GOP will finally crown nominees in what are expected to be two of the most competitive House races in the country in Texas and Maine https://t.co/OcHsj7m3a8

name: politico
text: 6Ô∏è‚É£ House Democrats will choose nominees in two competitive Texas seats that will have big implications on the House majority https://t.co/OcHsj7m3a8

name: politico
text: 7Ô∏è‚É£ Former Rep. Pete Sessions, a former chair of the National Republican Congressional Committee, is attempting a comeback bid 100 miles south of the Dallas-area seat he lost in the 2018 midterms https://t.co/OcHsj7m3a8 https://t.co/WBczMHhQQ6

name: politico
text: Debbie Wasserman Schultz proposes the creation of an advisory panel to ‚Äúrefocus federal spending decisions on the issues and demands of equity, justice, and diversity‚Äù https://t.co/CKUiI9dIXr

name: politico
text: Armed with an advantage in the polls, an outsider message and President Donald Trump's full-throated endorsement, Tommy Tuberville has spent the past 19 weeks sitting on his lead over Sessions https://t.co/5yP7R5JpgM

name: politico
text: And while Sessions has increasingly upped his attacks ‚Äî calling Tuberville unprepared and weak for refusing to debate him ‚Äî Tuberville hasn't taken the bait, avoiding direct confrontation with Sessions for months https://t.co/5yP7R5JpgM

name: politico
text: The two men are vying to take on Sen. Doug Jones, who won a special election in 2017 and is the most vulnerable Democrat up this year https://t.co/5yP7R5JpgM

name: politico
text: But instead of the pending matchup with Jones, the runoff has been defined by Trump's continued ridicule of Sessions, who held the Senate seat for two decades before Trump plucked him out of the chamber to take over the Justice Department https://t.co/5yP7R5JpgM

name: politico
text: As Trump and his party have seen their poll numbers slip over the past few months, a victory in Alabama is essential to Republicans' chances of retaining their Senate majority https://t.co/5yP7R5JpgM

name: politico
text: Using data from the COVID Tracking Project, we‚Äôre following how each state is responding to Covid-19. Here's where we stand this morning. https://t.co/r0HDQiaN3Z https://t.co/ReYELPrXUh

name: politico
text: The data isn‚Äôt perfect. Since the CDC hasn‚Äôt yet begun publicly releasing the number of people who have been tested, The COVID Tracking Project is pulling data from state health departments, which can vary in the way they report tests and infections.¬†https://t.co/r0HDQiaN3Z https://t.co/DM7xFiO0Ii

name: politico
text: According to a new schedule released by the court Monday, the justices will not hear the Obamacare case in October when their next term begins https://t.co/nqF9HgeMGr

name: politico
text: RT @ZacharyBrennan: Former CBER director Jesse Goodman calls for informed consent to be used if a vaccine is authorized for emergency use by FDA so those receiving it understand it's not a full approval https://t.co/7cBmxwzgF0

name: politico
text:
Austin, Texas' mayor criticized Gov. Abbott for blocking municipalities from enforcing mandatory mask orders earlier in the pandemic.

But he also praised Abbott for showing a greater willingness to encourage mask wearing than his fellow GOP governors https://t.co/fAWSlgcvy4 https://t.co/T50ejCDCJf

name: politico
text: Joe Biden signaled today that he would be open to the Senate ending its practice of imposing a 60-vote threshold for most legislation, a positional shift from the Democratic presidential nominee who spent more than 35 years as a senator https://t.co/2bwAqipMnG

name: politico
text:
Two national leaders tested positive for coronavirus, the pandemic is putting many international students‚Äô future in question and the World Health Organization continues to come under fire. Keep up with these stories. Read Global Translations. Subscribe.
https://t.co/FH94y3LIeE https://t.co/NlcK07aKpz

name: politico
text:
Mark Meadows came to the West Wing with big plans, hoping his friendship with President Trump would help him avoid turbulence.

Then reality ‚Äî and the coronavirus pandemic ‚Äî hit.

White House reporter @nancook has the story on POLITICO Dispatch üéß https://t.co/o1yaNayVt7 https://t.co/DenxtCSfou

name: politico
text: A day after his unexpected death and two days after his failed bid for the Democratic nomination in New Jersey‚Äôs 4th District, David Applefield's proposal for a ‚Äúmicro-cent‚Äù tax on Wall Street trade was introduced as potential state legislation https://t.co/1yIdTkrVMJ

name: politico
text: The House intends to quickly revive its legal effort to access President Trump's financial records ‚Äî and last night it asked for the Supreme Court's help to speed things up https://t.co/LIfmWzKPzm

name: politico
text: The Trump administration's deputy chief of staff for communications posted a cartoon critical of Dr. Fauci on Facebook over the weekend, sharing the work of an artist who was barred from the White House last year for anti-Semitic imagery https://t.co/4UVYx50GkV

name: politico
text:
Since fishermen are struggling to pull more salmon out of the seas, and farmers are struggling to secure permits, there‚Äôs been a frantic search for a new approach.

The future of protein might be salmon raised in a huge, air-conditioned suburban building https://t.co/e1iEZ1CvFi

name: politico
text: Senate Judiciary Chairman Lindsey Graham said he intends to grill former special counsel Robert Mueller about alleged flaws in the FBI‚Äôs investigation of links between the Trump campaign and Russia in 2016 https://t.co/SwRu0tutlo

name: politico
text: Under the terms of the ACA, HHS is required to submit a report to Congress detailing its efforts to alleviate racial health disparities every 2 years through the Office of Minority Health. The Trump administration hasn't submitted a report for 2017 or 2019 https://t.co/il4OXROt3Y

name: politico
text:
Our @PoliticoRyan and Jessica O. Matthews, CEO of Uncharted Power, discussed how many sustainability issues hit communities of color harder, whether it is flood zones, air pollution or energy affordability.

Full interviewüëâhttps://t.co/6irScbnzwN https://t.co/yDKEYmt8po

name: politico
text: Jeff Sessions' comeback bid is on the line. Will he survive Trump's opposition? Here's what else to watch in tonight's big primaries https://t.co/raAtmpuZ5u

name: politico
text: JPMorgan Chase notched higher-than-expected earnings in the second quarter but braced for losses from borrowers defaulting on their loans, as the bank's outlook for the U.S. economy becomes more pessimistic https://t.co/tGWaVauaQ0

name: politico
text: New York Times Opinion staff editor and writer Bari Weiss announced her resignation on Tuesday, decrying the newspaper's workplace culture as "hostile" towards staffers who hold anything other than left-of-center ideologies https://t.co/DvDMJ86ohh

name: politico
text:
Washington might be stuck when it comes to smart sustainability policy ‚Äî but cities and states aren‚Äôt, and neither are companies.

In our special The Agenda issue on sustainability, we explore six local ideas for making it work https://t.co/qPlkK22z0v

name: politico
text:
Since the 2008 financial crisis, regulators each year have required big banks to prove they could keep lending through new calamities.

But should banks be subject to a stress test for climate? And if yes, what would it look like?
 https://t.co/fq1WtgdWnG

name: politico
text: In a ruling this week, the bloc's top court is set to decide on the legality of instruments used to ferry data from the EU around the world ‚Äî and possibly a data protection deal with Washington known as Privacy Shield too https://t.co/Y8hLUwzvWk

name: politico
text: Government payments to farmers have surged to historic levels under President Donald Trump as the Agriculture Department floods the industry with cash to stem the financial losses from Trump‚Äôs tariff fights and the coronavirus pandemic https://t.co/PdIYaGp3XY

name: politico
text: Direct farm aid has climbed each year of Trump‚Äôs presidency, from $11.5 billion in 2017 to more than $32 billion this year ‚Äî an all-time high, with potentially far more funding still to come in 2020 https://t.co/PdIYaGp3XY

name: politico
text: Adm. Brett Giroir, the Trump administration‚Äôs coronavirus testing czar, on Tuesday rejected President Donald Trump‚Äôs suggestion that his own public health officials are liars https://t.co/p5B8AVFq9Z

name: politico
text:
We're sitting down with Kerry Washington to discuss "The Fight" ‚Äì a documentary she produced that chronicles four cases the ACLU brought against President Trump's administration.

Watch the interview tomorrow: https://t.co/ZspK7jMiJ4 https://t.co/Xho3iLKOsm

name: politico
text:
The conversation about making the U.S. economy more sustainable often centers on simply imposing new laws.

So we asked readers to share their own ideas that may not fit within traditional pro- and anti-regulation thinking üëáü§îhttps://t.co/az8CdhzIFm

name: politico
text: Is it a news outlet? Or is it a super PAC? A news outlet called Courier, funded by a Democratic-aligned digital group, has spent heavily on Facebook ads promoting its flattering articles and videos on House Democrats facing tough races. https://t.co/nJd3640nUg

name: politico
text:
In theory, the federal government is supposed to step in after natural disasters and help municipal governments rebuild.

But increasingly, the disaster relief checks aren‚Äôt arriving from Washington https://t.co/ZlBZZSRVxD

name: politico
text:
The world keeps eating more seafood, but the wild catch from the oceans has been stagnant for decades.

And a Norwegian company believes it has a sustainable solution to that problem: land-based aquaculture.

More in our Long Game newsletter üëáhttps://t.co/XqUEIp4Is0

name: politico
text: New polling shows a majority of voters support 10 key policies proposed by competing House and Senate bills that Congress failed to advance last month https://t.co/V76mHR4KVB

name: politico
text: America's biggest school systems are rejecting the president across the country, with one city and county after another opting for virtual education or just a few days a week in school. And the president has little power to do anything about it. https://t.co/BrScb1RZck

name: politico
text:
The latest models show the national Covid-19 death toll to eclipse 200,000 by Election Day. What impact will it have on the election? Will voting be affected? Keep up with critical coronavirus news and analysis with POLITICO Nightly. Subscribe now.
https://t.co/4vI42TQ6qb https://t.co/AAAoYJzztO

name: politico
text: Joe Biden signaled that he would be open to the Senate ending its practice of imposing a 60-vote threshold for most legislation, a positional shift from the Democratic presidential nominee who spent more than 35 years as a senator https://t.co/2bwAqipMnG

name: politico
text: Two of the country‚Äôs top universities won a major victory over the Trump administration on Tuesday after the government halted its plan to deport international college students who only use online courses to study this fall https://t.co/59HDQpaQQR

name: politico
text: Just after 2 A.M. this morning, the Supreme Court issued a 5-4 decision clearing way for inmates to be put to death. By 8 A.M., Daniel Lee became the first U.S. inmate to be executed in more than 17 years. https://t.co/UAYPKM99Lx

name: politico
text: Another execution is scheduled for tomorrow at the same Indiana prison, but is on hold due to a stay issued by a separate, unanimous 7th Circuit panel on July 2 https://t.co/V8XCDNIuqR

name: politico
text: On Saturday, the Justice Department filed an emergency application with the Supreme Court to lift the stay in that case so the execution could proceed as scheduled. No ruling on that application has emerged yet. https://t.co/V8XCDNIuqR

name: politico
text: A third execution is scheduled for Friday in Terre Haute and a fourth for late next month https://t.co/V8XCDNIuqR

name: politico
text: CDC Director Robert Redfield said President Trump should "set an example" by wearing a mask as he also warned the upcoming convergence of flu season and Covid could be ‚Äúone of the most difficult times that we have experienced in American public health" https://t.co/yRLLodafVe

name: politico
text: President Trump announced his intent to appoint controversial former aide Sebastian Gorka to a board that oversees the federal government‚Äôs national security education program https://t.co/Cbxaod9Z2X
